definition: just as/no less than/like (sth momentous)/as good as/tantamount to
only (classical, usually follows negative or question words)/(not) just
no less than from heaven to the abyss (idiom); differing widely/worlds apart/the gap couldn't be bigger

sentences.english: Carlin's book came as a godsend to the 72-year-old actor.
sentences.chinese: 对于这位72岁的演员，卡林的书不啻是个天赐良机。

sentences.english: You might as well throw your money into the sea as lend it to that rascal.
sentences.chinese: 你借钱给那个无赖，不啻把钱丢在海里。

sentences.english: Freedom in this sense is, of course, merely another namefor power or wealth.
sentences.chinese: 这种意义上的自由不啻为权力与财富之别名。

sentences.english: This not only is evangel to mankind, but also is great for our nation and people.
sentences.chinese: 这不啻是人类的福音，更是吾国吾民之幸。

sentences.english: Therefore some people turn their noses up at globalization fearing that it is in fact equivalent to Americanization .
sentences.chinese: 因此，一些人会不啻于全球化，担心其相当于美国化。

sentences.english: Few years ahead of you, well maybe more than a few.
sentences.chinese: 比你早几年，有可能还不啻。

sentences.english: They are to be had very cheap and good . we breathe but the air of books.
sentences.chinese: 书笈价廉物美，不啻我们呼吸的空气。

sentences.english: The financial crisis made a mockery of both assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 金融危机不啻是对这两个假设的无情嘲笑。

sentences.english: He that hath wife and children hath given hostages to fortune;
sentences.chinese: 夫人之有妻儿也，不啻已向命运典质。

definition: only (classical, usually follows negative or question words)/(not) just
nothing other than/to differ in no way from/the same as/to amount to
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
easy as a hand's turn (idiom); very easy/no effort at all
